opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class PhraseWriter

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      java.io.FilterWriter
          opennlp.ccg.alignment.PhraseWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, Appendable
Direct Known Subclasses:
IdentifiedPhraseWriter
public class PhraseWriter
extends FilterWriter

A writer for phrases. This writer writes phrase instances to the underlying writer with the specified string as a word separator. No markup is placed around phrases that are written; only a line separator is written after the phrase.

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
Alignments.untokenize(String[], String)

Constructor Detail

PhraseWriter

public PhraseWriter(Writer out)
Creates a new phrase writer with the default word separator.

See Also:
PhraseWriter(Writer, String), Alignments.DEFAULT_WORD_SEPARATOR

PhraseWriter

public PhraseWriter(Writer out,
                    String wordSeparator)
Creates a new phrase writer for the underlying input stream that will use the specified word separator when untokenizing phrases.

Parameters:
wordSeparator - The word separator to use when translating phrases into strings.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if wordSeparator is null.
See Also:
Alignments.untokenize(String[], String)
Method Detail

getWordSeparator

public String getWordSeparator()
Gets the word separator that this phrase writer uses when writing phrases.

writePhrase

public void writePhrase(Phrase phrase)
                 throws IOException
Writes a phrase by untokenizing its words according to the word separator being used. Before writing the untokenized phrase, preWritePhrase(Phrase) is called exactly once. After writing the phrase, postWritePhrase(Phrase) is called exactly once.

Parameters:
phrase - The phrase to write.
Throws:
IOException - If the underlying writer throws an IOException, or if one is thrown by either preWritePhrase(Phrase) or postWritePhrase(Phrase).

preWritePhrase

protected void preWritePhrase(Phrase phrase)
                       throws IOException
Called before writePhrase(Phrase) (to be overridden by implementing classes).

Parameters:
phrase - The phrase about to be written.
Throws:
IOException

postWritePhrase

protected void postWritePhrase(Phrase phrase)
                        throws IOException
Called after writePhrase(Phrase) (to be overridden by implementing classes). This implementation just writes a line separator.

Parameters:
phrase - The phrase that was just written.
Throws:
IOException
